questions.question: What is the correct signature for the main method in Java?
Which data type should be used to store text in Java?
What primitive data type in Java is commonly used to store decimal numbers?
Which operator is used to compare two values for equality in Java?
Which keyword is used to declare a constant in Java?
What statement is used to exit a loop prematurely in Java?
How do you find the length of a String in Java?
Which method is used to convert a String to an int in Java?
What is the logical AND operator in Java?
How do you get the length of an array named 'arr' in Java?
What is it called when a class has multiple methods with the same name but different parameters?
Which keyword is used to specify the value a method should return?
What keyword allows a method to be called without creating an instance of the class?
How does a recursive method typically work?
questions.correct_answer: It's called recursively until a base case is reached
choices: It's called recursively until a base case is reached
It calls other methods until completion
It processes in an infinite loop
It returns null until all cases are resolved

questions.question: List the four access modifiers in Java from most to least restrictive.
In object-oriented programming, what is a class?
choices: A function that groups variables and methods

questions.question: Which keyword is used to create an instance of a class?
What method call is used to invoke a superclass constructor?
What is the main purpose of encapsulation in Java?
questions.correct_answer: To hide the internal details of how an object functions
choices: To hide the internal details of how an object functions
To prevent unauthorized access to methods
To allow inheritance from a superclass

questions.question: Which keyword is used to define a subclass in Java?
What is the principle of polymorphism in Java?
questions.correct_answer: An object can be treated as an instance of its superclass
choices: An object can be treated as an instance of its superclass
An object can be cloned into multiple instances
A class can have multiple constructors
A class can inherit multiple superclasses

questions.question: Which access modifier should be used for encapsulating class attributes?
What is the purpose of inner classes in Java?
questions.correct_answer: To define a class within another class
choices: To define a class within another class

questions.question: Which keyword is used to declare a method that has no body?
